summary:
Bran: Jon is the true heir to the iron throne.
Also Bran: So... Jon kinda fucked up big, didn't see that coming. Actually, I saw...
body:
Bran: Jon is the true heir to the iron throne.

Also Bran: So… Jon kinda fucked up big, didn’t see that coming. Actually, I saw the fuck up, just couldn’t read his mind y'know?… Guess I’ll be king then.

summary: the show runners literally admitting that they wanted to kill Bran off early in s8 just proves that this entire season is...
body: the show runners literally admitting that they wanted to kill Bran off early in s8 just proves that this entire season is fanfiction for them. The ending is Bran on the throne with a bunch of other men counseling him. If they were originally going to kill him off in early season 8 then why is he on the throne lmao.

summary: He saw Sansa crying herself to sleep at night, and he saw Arya watching in silence and holding her secrets hard in her heart....
text: He saw Sansa crying herself to sleep at night, and he saw Arya watching in silence and holding her secrets hard in her heart. There were shadows all around them. One shadow was dark as ash, with the terrible face of a hound. Another was armored like the sun, golden and beautiful. Over them both loomed a giant in armor made of stone, but when he opened his visor, there was nothing inside but darkness and thick black blood

summary: Well, this explains why Bran’s been being written so terribly for seasons then, because they wanted to kill him way back -...
body:
Well, this explains why Bran’s been being written so terribly for seasons then, because they wanted to kill him way back - probably why they ditched him in S5 under the guise of ‘He’s learning powers’, they’ve just never actually understood how damn important Bran as a character is.

And also makes me feel somewhat hopeful for Daenerys. She may well die, as a hero in the War for Dawn. I mean, in many respects you could argue that’s what she’s always been building towards. But she won’t be put down like a rabid dog by Jon. This kinda says to me that GRRM isn’t really as involved as we think (fear) and it will go down very very differently in the books. Everything they’re doing is for ‘shock factor’. Quote ‘SHOCKER SACRIFICE’ bye.

blog.name: springwolvesofwinterfell
blog.title: Spring comes to Winterfell
blog.description: My personal collection of GoT/ ASoIaF

title: Who really loves Jon?
body:
I seldom complain much about the fandom, but I have to say, I’m so annoyed that some people keep calling Jon “Aegon Targaryen”, at the same time denying his claim to the Throne and blaming him for telling Sansa and Arya the truth about his parentage, for not pleasing Dany the night she burnt Varys, etc., etc.

Like, wtf???

If they see him as Aegon Targaryen, Dany has no right to demand him to bend the knee, she has no right to say to him the Iron Throne is hers, she has no right to demand him conceal the truth about his parentage, she has no right to threaten the safety of every single person he loves to keep him silent.

She can beg him to let her sit on the Throne, but she cannot demand him anything!!

Do these self-proclaimed Jon/J*nerys fans really love Jon at all? Those who justify Dany’s stance on blaming Jon about his parentage want him to stay with Dany, not as a Targaryen, but in fact, a servant. And worse, they want him to be loyal to her and her only, and separate him from those who truly love him (the Starklings, Ghost, Sam, Tormund,…). That means he would belong to nowhere, neither Targs nor Starks, nor wildings. They are exactly the same as Dany. She does not accept Jon as a Targ, as her family, but her subject. She still wants him to stay with her, be her servant and her (I’m sorry for saying this) s*xtoy.

While Dany rejects Jon’s Targaryen lineage…

Gif:  gameofthronesdaily

See how these people treat Jon…

Sansa takes care of him, she acknowledges him as a Stark, as Ned’s son at every turn.

She supports him to be King in the North. She never presses her claim (’though she has a better claim than him), she holds the North for him in his absence, she protects him from political opposition, she gets angry when he gives up his crown, no matter how frustrated she is with him, she never loses her faith in him.

After learning about his parentage, Sansa still wants Jon to stay in WF, she is worried of him going South because the men in her family didn’t do well in the South. He is still her family, she sees him as a Stark. But she respects his Targ lineage if that is his choice. She believes him to be a better ruler than Dany is. 

Gif: jontargaryn

Arya also loves Jon and is protective of him.

She acknowledges Jon as her brother, no matter what. And I’m sure it does not change even after she learns about his parentage. 

Bran respects Jon’s choice. He lets Jon decide when to tell Sansa and Arya. He lets Jon decide whether he wants to see himself as a Targ or a Stark. 

Tormund says Jon has the real North in him. 

So, who have Jon’s best interest in their minds? Who accept him? Who love Jon truly and let him be free and have his own choice? On the contrary, who rejects and restrains him?

We already know the answer. And the coming finale will confirm it.

summary: I really hope Bran is revealed to be an active participant against the threat of fire (D*ny). If anyone should be revealed to...
question: I really hope Bran is revealed to be an active participant against the threat of fire (D*ny). If anyone should be revealed to have sent Cersei a scroll to ambush Dany, it should be him (with a Sam assist). It would answer all those "Idk why isn't see-all, know-all Bran helping D*ny?!" queries. It's because he's still a Stark and he don't like her ass!
answer: I would love this esp since her stans have been blaming Bran for all her problems

reblog.comment: I would love this esp since her stans have been blaming Bran for all her problems

trail.content_raw: I would love this esp since her stans have been blaming Bran for all her problems

summary: Isaac shares his opinion about the viral Game of Thrones petition: "It's ridiculous that people think they can just demand a...
body: Isaac shares his opinion about the viral Game of Thrones petition: “It’s ridiculous that people think they can just demand a different ending because they don’t like it. I have stupidly taken it quite personally, which obviously I shouldn’t”. Via The Hollywood Reporter

summary: this is the season has been good to me: sansa was shown once again to be a capable leader and a smart one too cersei was proven...
body:
this is the season has been good to me:

  • sansa was shown once again to be a capable leader and a smart one too
  • cersei was proven to be a better queen than dany in every way except for the fact that she didn’t have dragons (or elephants)
  • jaime didn’t murder cersei
  • the north’s independence was a big point
  • all the fantasies people held of sansa being ganged up on by her family and allies are dead in a ditch
  • bran’s slowly getting his humanity back
  • the night king died a flop before he could hurt my son
  • a stark with 0 targ blood killed the night king
  • dark dany happened and it proved what we’ve been saying for years
  • another dragon died and i even had the pleasure of seeing viserion die a second time
  • sansa positivity everywhere
  • theon and sansa reunited and had a few hours together
  • theon died a hero

this is the season has been good to me:

  • sansa was shown once again to be a capable leader and a smart one too
  • cersei was proven to be a better queen than dany in every way except for the fact that she didn’t have dragons (or elephants)
  • jaime didn’t murder cersei
  • the north’s independence was a big point
  • all the fantasies people held of sansa being ganged up on by her family and allies are dead in a ditch
  • bran’s slowly getting his humanity back
  • the night king died a flop before he could hurt my son
  • a stark with 0 targ blood killed the night king
  • dark dany happened and it proved what we’ve been saying for years
  • another dragon died and i even had the pleasure of seeing viserion die a second time
  • sansa positivity everywhere
  • theon and sansa reunited and had a few hours together
  • theon died a hero

summary: Hodor is an incredibly strong and tall (over seven feet tall) half-giant. He is mentally disabled and is only capable of saying...
caption:
Hodor is an incredibly strong and tall (over seven feet tall) half-giant. He is mentally disabled and is only capable of saying one work…Hodor, but he can still understand complex instructions others give him. Now if you watch GoT and aren’t done with Season 6 yet, I’d advise to stop reading this, because personally I’d say this is a pretty big spoiler.

—————————————————————————

“Hodor” is a seemingly nonsense word, though in the process it became the name everyone calls him. It is derived from the phrase “hold the door”, the words that Hodor heard during the seizure that mentally disabled him as a result of the future Bran Stark accidentally warging into his young self during a vision. Nonetheless, House Stark set him to work at a productive occupation within his capacities, as a stableboy serving at Winterfell. He is gentle and loyal to the Starks, he is also Old Nan’s great-grandson and only known relative.

—————————————————————————

Straight up, he dies, as do it seems most of the characters (maybe I’m wrong, idk I’m only on Season 7 sry). But jeez, I was in such a good mood, and then they got to his death scene and suddenly an hour had passed and I was still crying. I don’t know if his death hit y’all like it hit me (comment please if it did), but jeez it really shook me. While chillin with the Three eyed raven, Bran goes against the T.E.R’s (three eyed raven’s) wishes and has a vision without the T.E.R there too. The consequences of his actions end up with a White Walker touching him and giving them access to the cave where he is staying. While the White Walkers and the wights storm the cave, Bran (who is currently unconscious and still in a vision) wargs into Hodor’s mind linking the minds of the present-day Hodor and the young stable boy Wylis from the past (thus giving him a seizure (in the past) and causing his mental trauma). In the past (while Bran is warging through Wylis’s mind) Hodor experiences his own future death (thus also damaging his mind further) and he also hears Meera telling him futuristically to “hold the door” (so that her and Bran can escape).

Hodor literally (basically (in my opinion)) lived his entire life for Bran and Meera. As a rather young boy, Hodor already knew how he was going to die. And once the time came, he held the door, and never let go. He sacrificed his life and was torn apart by the wights to allow for Bran and Meera to continue to survive.

blog.name: shadowofdarkness22
blog.title: So- AHHHH
blog.description:
Hey I'm Shadow.
Female. 26. Gamer.
This is a ship friendly blog. You like a certain ship? I dont care whether I like it or not because I mind my own damn business and leave you alone.
I'm open minded to multiple ships in one fandom because why the fuck not? That doesn't mean I don't have an OTP I'm just chill.
Xemnas/Sora shipper since KH2 came out.
I write.
I make videos sometimes.
I post my friend's art for her since she doesn't have a tumblr.
I reblog whatever is my fancy. I also get random mood changes and spam random things straight. Oops. 
I will most likely post something REALLY clever every so often.

tags: i invite other writers to help me fill thr tag
summary: Despite the fact that my game of thrones knowledge isn't as accurate as someone whose watched the show since season 1... I'm...
body: Despite the fact that my game of thrones knowledge isn’t as accurate as someone whose watched the show since season 1… I’m gonna write this fic whether it’s the last thing I do! People need fics and I’m gonna do my best to fulfill that!!
